project_abstract.cdata: The Transparency and Governance Capacity Building Project will finance the necessary technical assistance to implement the Post-Conflict Economic Rehabilitation Credit Project, in the first Transitional Support Strategy, and, will enhance efforts that should lead to the mobilization of more resources, and faster economic recovery in The Republic of Congo. The primary development objective of this project will be to increase the efficiency of petroleum operations; of the Ministry of Economy, Finance and Budget (MOFEB) financial operations; and, of the Government's public enterprise reform, and privatization process. While the project's support to the three-year Interim Post-Conflict Program, and structural reforms, will improve transparency of decision-making in the government, and its agencies - prioritizing on the management of oil resources, and state budgetary expenditures - and, strengthen partnership, and dialogue among government, civil society, and the private sector, risks include the resurgence of political instability, particularly if the international community fails to support the peace process. Mitigation measures - outside the control of this project - include support to a comprehensive disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration program, through political dialogue, and willingness to implement reforms. The operation will contribute to minimize risks by strengthening capacity, and the dialogue and partnerships promoted through the project.
